examples:
Input:arr = [4,2,3,0,3,1,2], start = 5Output:trueExplanation:All possible ways to reach at index 3 with value 0 are: 
index 5 -> index 4 -> index 1 -> index 3 
index 5 -> index 6 -> index 4 -> index 1 -> index 3

Input:arr = [4,2,3,0,3,1,2], start = 0Output:trueExplanation:One possible way to reach at index 3 with value 0 is: 
index 0 -> index 4 -> index 1 -> index 3
Input:arr = [3,0,2,1,2], start = 2Output:falseExplanation:There is no way to reach at index 1 with value 0.
data.problem_statement:
Given an array of non-negative integersarr, you are initially positioned atstartindex of the array. When you are at indexi, you can jump toi + arr[i]ori - arr[i], check if you can reachanyindex with value 0.

Notice that you can not jump outside of the array at any time.
data.title: Jump Game III
